author: Microsoft
description:
From chalkboards to tablets, technology has transformed the NFL, and the Green Bay Packers are leading that evolution. In this episode, Ed Policy, president and CEO of the Packers, joins Microsoft's Vice Chair and President Brad Smith to explore how digital tools on the sidelines and innovation hubs like TitletownTech are reshaping the game and driving economic growth beyond Lambeau Field. 

Ed shares the three principles guiding every decision: win football games, keep the Packers in Green Bay, and strengthen the community. From growing up in an Ohio football family to steering a uniquely community‑owned franchise into the future, it’s a conversation about leadership, tech, and purpose in a changing world.

Chapters: 
0:00 - Intro
1:33 - Dinner table lessons from Ed's father (and NFL legend) Carmen Policy 
3:06 - Green Bay Packers: the NFL's only publicly owned team 
5:15 - Investing in Green Bay with Titletown
8:46 - Titletown Ventures and Titletown Tech
12:32 - Tech's role in footb
title: Ed Policy, Green Bay Packers: How tech is changing the game

author: Microsoft
description:
In our first episode of Discovered at Microsoft, we're exploring Analog Optical Computers, systems that harness the power of light, not ones and zeros.

Learn more: https://news.microsoft.com/source/features/innovation/microsoft-analog-optical-computer-cracks-two-practical-problems-shows-ai-promise/?msockid=04c274e1c1aa675306fe6737c0d166b7

title: This Microsoft Lab is Building Computers that Run on Light | Discovered at Microsoft Ep. 1
